definitions.definition: To form stitches in; especially, to sew in such a manner as to show on the surface a continuous line of stitches.
To sew, or unite or attach by stitches.
examples: to stitch printed sheets in making a book or a pamphlet.

definitions.definition: To practice / practise stitching or needlework.
To weld together through a series of connecting or overlapping spot welds .
To include, combine, or unite into a single whole.

subdefinitions.definition: To combine two or more photographs of the same scene into a single image .
examples: I can use this software to stitch together a panorama.

subdefinitions.definition: To incorporate (an existing video ) into a new one, resulting in a collaborative clip that shows the two videos in a sequence .

main_definition: To form stitches in; especially, to sew in such a manner as to show on the surface a continuous line of stitches.
secondary_definitions: To sew, or unite or attach by stitches.
( intransitive ) To practice / practise stitching or needlework.
( agriculture ) To form land into ridges .
To weld together through a series of connecting or overlapping spot welds .
To include, combine, or unite into a single whole.
